page.title: Mōchirīī Recruitment
page.subtitle: Notes on growing a steady, welcoming guild

overview.intro: Let’s take a moment to talk about recruiting, because it matters deeply to the long-term strength of Mōchirīī.
overview.focus: Recruitment is a skill shaped by practice, observation, and intention. Every interaction teaches something about what brings people in and what helps them stay.
overview.philosophy: Growth works best when participation comes naturally and community remains at the center.

principles.title: Participation Matters
principles.description: Even one new member makes a difference. A single invitation can become a long-term presence, a future leader, or someone who quietly supports others when it matters most.

principles.title: Momentum Builds Community
principles.description: Activity creates energy. Energy creates presence. Presence builds confidence. A living guild draws people in through shared experience.

principles.title: Balance Creates Stability
principles.description: A steady population allows events, mentorship, leadership, and different playstyles to exist together in a healthy way.

recruitmentMethods.title: Forum Presence
recruitmentMethods.description: Clear, current posts signal stability and care. A visible presence builds trust and draws interest naturally.

recruitmentMethods.title: Playing Together
recruitmentMethods.description: Shared experiences build familiarity. When runs feel relaxed and welcoming, conversations form naturally.

recruitmentMethods.title: Being Observant
recruitmentMethods.description: Sometimes recruiting is as simple as noticing when someone is looking for a place to belong and reaching out with care.

recruitmentMethods.title: Announcements
recruitmentMethods.description: Used sparingly, clear messages help maintain visibility during quieter periods and open doors to conversation.

retention.summary: When recruitment feels slow, the answer often lies in retention.
retention.details: People stay when they feel seen, guided, and included. Structure creates stability. Organization provides direction. These elements keep communities grounded.

leadership.members: Every message, conversation, and invitation contributes to the guild’s long-term health.
leadership.leaders: Strong leadership creates space for growth, mentorship, and continuity. Today’s members become tomorrow’s anchors.

closing.message: Mōchirīī is meant to feel warm, alive, and welcoming. We build it together, one person at a time.
closing.callToAction: Let’s continue growing something worth staying for.
